title: Indian, Twice Removed
description: Guyanese-Indian immigrants in New York City say they are not embraced by city's more flourishing Indian-American community and for their own part have not made overtures to it; have created neighborhood for themselves in Richmond Hill, Queens, rather than seeking acceptance in Indian neighborhoods of Flushing and Elmhurst; feel more natural alignment with New Yorkers from Trinidad and Tobago who are of Indian descent; some Indians believe chill between groups is exaggerated; scholars predict atitudes will eventually change; photos (L)
dc:creator: Joseph Berger
